briefdescription.para: Returns the range of the current selection.

detaileddescription.para: The end point of range is specified as the last character position of the span of text, plus one. If the return values from and to are the same, there is no selection.

briefdescription.para: Returns the range of the current selection.

detaileddescription.para: The end point of range is specified as the last character position of the span of text, plus one. If the return values from and to are the same, there is no selection.

briefdescription.para: Returns the range of the current selection.

detaileddescription.para: The end point of range is specified as the last character position of the span of text, plus one. If the return values from and to are the same, there is no selection.

briefdescription.para: Returns an object that stores information about context menu property item(s), in order to communicate between the context menu event handler and the code that responds to it.

detaileddescription.para: The wxRichTextContextMenuPropertiesInfo stores one item for each object that could respond to a property-editing event. If objects are nested, several might be editable.

briefdescription.para: Returns an object that stores information about context menu property item(s), in order to communicate between the context menu event handler and the code that responds to it.

detaileddescription.para: The wxRichTextContextMenuPropertiesInfo stores one item for each object that could respond to a property-editing event. If objects are nested, several might be editable.

briefdescription.para: Gets the attributes at the given position.

detaileddescription.para: This function gets the combined style - that is, the style you see on the screen as a result of combining base style, paragraph style and character style attributes.
To get the character or paragraph style alone, use GetUncombinedStyle().
wxPerl Note: In wxPerl this method is implemented as GetStyle(position) returning a 2-element list (ok, attr).

briefdescription.para: Gets the attributes at the given position.

detaileddescription.para: This function gets the combined style - that is, the style you see on the screen as a result of combining base style, paragraph style and character style attributes.
To get the character or paragraph style alone, use GetUncombinedStyle().
wxPerl Note: In wxPerl this method is implemented as GetStyle(position) returning a 2-element list (ok, attr).

briefdescription.para: Gets the attributes at the given position.

detaileddescription.para: This function gets the combined style - that is, the style you see on the screen as a result of combining base style, paragraph style and character style attributes.
To get the character or paragraph style alone, use GetUncombinedStyle().
wxPerl Note: In wxPerl this method is implemented as GetStyle(position) returning a 2-element list (ok, attr).

briefdescription.para: Sets the attributes for the given range.

detaileddescription.para: The end point of range is specified as the last character position of the span of text, plus one.
So, for example, to set the style for a character at position 5, use the range (5,6).

briefdescription.para: Sets the attributes for the given range.

detaileddescription.para: The end point of range is specified as the last character position of the span of text, plus one.
So, for example, to set the style for a character at position 5, use the range (5,6).

So, for example, to set the style for a character at position 5, use the range (5,6).

briefdescription.para: Sets the attributes for the given range.

detaileddescription.para: The end point of range is specified as the last character position of the span of text, plus one.
So, for example, to set the style for a character at position 5, use the range (5,6).

briefdescription.para: Gets the attributes common to the specified range.

detaileddescription.para: Attributes that differ in value within the range will not be included in style flags.
wxPerl Note: In wxPerl this method is implemented as GetStyleForRange(position) returning a 2-element list (ok, attr).

briefdescription.para: Gets the attributes common to the specified range.

detaileddescription.para: Attributes that differ in value within the range will not be included in style flags.
wxPerl Note: In wxPerl this method is implemented as GetStyleForRange(position) returning a 2-element list (ok, attr).

briefdescription.para: Gets the attributes common to the specified range.

detaileddescription.para: Attributes that differ in value within the range will not be included in style flags.
wxPerl Note: In wxPerl this method is implemented as GetStyleForRange(position) returning a 2-element list (ok, attr).

briefdescription.para: Gets the attributes at the given position.

detaileddescription.para: This function gets the uncombined style - that is, the attributes associated with the paragraph or character content, and not necessarily the combined attributes you see on the screen. To get the combined attributes, use GetStyle().
If you specify (any) paragraph attribute in style's flags, this function will fetch the paragraph attributes. Otherwise, it will return the character attributes.
wxPerl Note: In wxPerl this method is implemented as GetUncombinedStyle(position) returning a 2-element list (ok, attr).

briefdescription.para: Gets the attributes at the given position.

detaileddescription.para: This function gets the uncombined style - that is, the attributes associated with the paragraph or character content, and not necessarily the combined attributes you see on the screen. To get the combined attributes, use GetStyle().
If you specify (any) paragraph attribute in style's flags, this function will fetch the paragraph attributes. Otherwise, it will return the character attributes.
wxPerl Note: In wxPerl this method is implemented as GetUncombinedStyle(position) returning a 2-element list (ok, attr).

briefdescription.para: Sets the current default style, which can be used to change how subsequently inserted text is displayed.
Sets the current default style, which can be used to change how subsequently inserted text is displayed.

memberdef.argsstring: (const wxRichTextRange &range, wxRichTextListStyleDefinition *def, int flags=wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_WITH_UNDO, int startFrom=1, int specifiedLevel=-1)
memberdef.name: SetListStyle

briefdescription.para: Sets the list attributes for the given range, passing flags to determine how the attributes are set.

detaileddescription.para:
Either the style definition or the name of the style definition (in the current sheet) can be passed. flags is a bit list of the following:
wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_WITH_UNDO: specifies that this command will be undoable.
wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_RENUMBER: specifies that numbering should start from startFrom, otherwise existing attributes are used.
wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_SPECIFY_LEVEL: specifies that listLevel should be used as the level for all paragraphs, otherwise the current indentation will be used.

memberdef.argsstring: (const wxRichTextRange &range, const wxString &defName, int flags=wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_WITH_UNDO, int startFrom=1, int specifiedLevel=-1)
memberdef.name: SetListStyle

briefdescription.para: Sets the list attributes for the given range, passing flags to determine how the attributes are set.

detaileddescription.para:
Either the style definition or the name of the style definition (in the current sheet) can be passed. flags is a bit list of the following:
wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_WITH_UNDO: specifies that this command will be undoable.
wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_RENUMBER: specifies that numbering should start from startFrom, otherwise existing attributes are used.
wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_SPECIFY_LEVEL: specifies that listLevel should be used as the level for all paragraphs, otherwise the current indentation will be used.

memberdef.argsstring: (const wxRichTextRange &range, wxRichTextListStyleDefinition *def=NULL, int flags=wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_WITH_UNDO, int startFrom=1, int specifiedLevel=-1)

Either the style definition or the name of the style definition (in the current sheet) can be passed.

flags is a bit list of the following:
wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_WITH_UNDO: specifies that this command will be undoable.
wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_RENUMBER: specifies that numbering should start from startFrom, otherwise existing attributes are used.
wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_SPECIFY_LEVEL: specifies that listLevel should be used as the level for all paragraphs, otherwise the current indentation will be used.

detaileddescription.para: Pass flags to determine how the attributes are set.
Either the style definition or the name of the style definition (in the current sheet) can be passed.

flags is a bit list of the following:
wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_WITH_UNDO: specifies that this command will be undoable.
wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_RENUMBER: specifies that numbering should start from startFrom, otherwise existing attributes are used.
wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_SPECIFY_LEVEL: specifies that listLevel should be used as the level for all paragraphs, otherwise the current indentation will be used.

memberdef.argsstring: (int promoteBy, const wxRichTextRange &range, wxRichTextListStyleDefinition *def=NULL, int flags=wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_WITH_UNDO, int specifiedLevel=-1)
memberdef.name: PromoteList

briefdescription.para: Promotes or demotes the paragraphs in the given range.

detaileddescription.para: A positive promoteBy produces a smaller indent, and a negative number produces a larger indent. Pass flags to determine how the attributes are set. Either the style definition or the name of the style definition (in the current sheet) can be passed.

flags is a bit list of the following:
wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_WITH_UNDO: specifies that this command will be undoable.
wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_RENUMBER: specifies that numbering should start from startFrom, otherwise existing attributes are used.
wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_SPECIFY_LEVEL: specifies that listLevel should be used as the level for all paragraphs, otherwise the current indentation will be used.

memberdef.argsstring: (int promoteBy, const wxRichTextRange &range, const wxString &defName, int flags=wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_WITH_UNDO, int specifiedLevel=-1)
memberdef.name: PromoteList

briefdescription.para: Promotes or demotes the paragraphs in the given range.

detaileddescription.para: A positive promoteBy produces a smaller indent, and a negative number produces a larger indent. Pass flags to determine how the attributes are set. Either the style definition or the name of the style definition (in the current sheet) can be passed.

flags is a bit list of the following:
wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_WITH_UNDO: specifies that this command will be undoable.
wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_RENUMBER: specifies that numbering should start from startFrom, otherwise existing attributes are used.
wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_SPECIFY_LEVEL: specifies that listLevel should be used as the level for all paragraphs, otherwise the current indentation will be used.

detaileddescription.para: The end point of range is specified as the last character position of the span of text, plus one.
So, for example, to set the selection for a character at position 5, use the range (5,6).

Returns the buffer associated with the control.
Text buffer.
Caret position (1 less than the character position, so -1 is the first caret position).
Caret position when the default formatting has been changed.

detaileddescription.para: As soon as this position changes, we no longer reflect the default style in the UI.

briefdescription.para: Selection range in character positions. -2, -2 means no selection.
Anchor so we know how to extend the selection It's a caret position since it's between two characters.
Anchor object if selecting multiple container objects, such as grid cells.
Are we editable?
Are we showing the caret position at the start of a line instead of at the end of the previous one?
Are we dragging a selection?
Do we need full layout in idle?
Threshold for doing delayed layout.
Cursors.
The object that currently has the editing focus.
Default constructor.

briefdescription.para: Constructor, creating and showing a rich text control.

Window identifier. The value wxID_ANY indicates a default value.

briefdescription.para: Creates the underlying window.
Initialises the members of the control.
Gets the text for the given range.

detaileddescription.para: The end point of range is specified as the last character position of the span of text, plus one.

briefdescription.para: Returns the length of the specified line in characters.
Returns the text for the given line.
Returns the number of lines in the buffer.
Returns true if the buffer has been modified.
Returns true if the control is editable.
Returns true if the control is single-line.

detaileddescription.para: Currently wxRichTextCtrl does not support single-line editing.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the control is multiline.
Returns the text within the current selection range, if any.
Gets the current filename associated with the control.
Sets the current filename.
Sets the size of the buffer beyond which layout is delayed during resizing.

detaileddescription.para: This optimizes sizing for large buffers. The default is 20000.

briefdescription.para: Gets the size of the buffer beyond which layout is delayed during resizing.

detaileddescription.para: This optimizes sizing for large buffers. The default is 20000.

briefdescription.para: Sets the text (normal) cursor.
Returns the text (normal) cursor.
Sets the cursor to be used over URLs.
Returns the cursor to be used over URLs.
Returns true if we are showing the caret position at the start of a line instead of at the end of the previous one.
Sets a flag to remember that we are showing the caret position at the start of a line instead of at the end of the previous one.
Returns true if we are extending a selection.
Sets a flag to remember if we are extending a selection.
Are we trying to start Drag'n'Drop?
Set if we're trying to start Drag'n'Drop.
Get the possible Drag'n'Drop start point.
Set the possible Drag'n'Drop start point.
Get the possible Drag'n'Drop start time.
Set the possible Drag'n'Drop start time.
Returns the current context menu.
Sets the current context menu.
Returns an anchor so we know how to extend the selection.

detaileddescription.para: It's a caret position since it's between two characters.

briefdescription.para: Sets an anchor so we know how to extend the selection.

detaileddescription.para: It's a caret position since it's between two characters.

briefdescription.para: Returns the anchor object if selecting multiple containers.
Sets the anchor object if selecting multiple containers.
Returns the wxRichTextObject object that currently has the editing focus.

detaileddescription.para: If there are no composite objects, this will be the top-level buffer.

briefdescription.para: Setter for m_focusObject.
Sets the wxRichTextObject object that currently has the editing focus.

parameterdescription.para: The wxRichTextObject to set focus on.

briefdescription.para: Invalidates the whole buffer to trigger painting later.
Clears the buffer content, leaving a single empty paragraph.

detaileddescription.para: Cannot be undone.

briefdescription.para: Replaces the content in the specified range with the string specified by value.
Removes the content in the specified range.
Loads content into the control's buffer using the given type.

detaileddescription.para: If the specified type is wxRICHTEXT_TYPE_ANY, the type is deduced from the filename extension.
This function looks for a suitable wxRichTextFileHandler object.

briefdescription.para: Helper function for LoadFile().

detaileddescription.para: Loads content into the control's buffer using the given type.
If the specified type is wxRICHTEXT_TYPE_ANY, the type is deduced from the filename extension.
This function looks for a suitable wxRichTextFileHandler object.

briefdescription.para: Saves the buffer content using the given type.

detaileddescription.para: If the specified type is wxRICHTEXT_TYPE_ANY, the type is deduced from the filename extension.
This function looks for a suitable wxRichTextFileHandler object.

briefdescription.para: Helper function for SaveFile().

detaileddescription.para: Saves the buffer content using the given type.
If the specified type is wxRICHTEXT_TYPE_ANY, the type is deduced from the filename extension.
This function looks for a suitable wxRichTextFileHandler object.

briefdescription.para: Sets flags that change the behaviour of loading or saving.

detaileddescription.para: See the documentation for each handler class to see what flags are relevant for each handler.

briefdescription.para: Returns flags that change the behaviour of loading or saving.

detaileddescription.para: See the documentation for each handler class to see what flags are relevant for each handler.

briefdescription.para: Marks the buffer as modified.
Sets the buffer's modified status to false, and clears the buffer's command history.
Sets the maximum number of characters that may be entered in a single line text control.

detaileddescription.para: For compatibility only; currently does nothing.

briefdescription.para: Writes text at the current position.
Sets the insertion point to the end of the buffer and writes the text.
Sets the attributes for a single object.
Sets the attributes for the given range, passing flags to determine how the attributes are set.

detaileddescription.para: The end point of range is specified as the last character position of the span of text, plus one. So, for example, to set the style for a character at position 5, use the range (5,6).

flags may contain a bit list of the following values:
wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_NONE: no style flag.
wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_WITH_UNDO: specifies that this operation should be undoable.
wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_OPTIMIZE: specifies that the style should not be applied if the combined style at this point is already the style in question.
wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_PARAGRAPHS_ONLY: specifies that the style should only be applied to paragraphs, and not the content. This allows content styling to be preserved independently from that of e.g. a named paragraph style.
wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_CHARACTERS_ONLY: specifies that the style should only be applied to characters, and not the paragraph. This allows content styling to be preserved independently from that of e.g. a named paragraph style.
wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_RESET: resets (clears) the existing style before applying the new style.
wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_REMOVE: removes the specified style. Only the style flags are used in this operation.

briefdescription.para: Returns the current default style, which can be used to change how subsequently inserted text is displayed.
Clears the list style from the given range, clearing list-related attributes and applying any named paragraph style associated with each paragraph.

detaileddescription.para:
flags is a bit list of the following:
wxRICHTEXT_SETSTYLE_WITH_UNDO: specifies that this command will be undoable.

briefdescription.para: Sets the properties for the given range, passing flags to determine how the attributes are set.

detaileddescription.para: You can merge properties or replace them.
The end point of range is specified as the last character position of the span of text, plus one. So, for example, to set the properties for a character at position 5, use the range (5,6).

flags may contain a bit list of the following values:
wxRICHTEXT_SETSPROPERTIES_NONE: no flag.
wxRICHTEXT_SETPROPERTIES_WITH_UNDO: specifies that this operation should be undoable.
wxRICHTEXT_SETPROPERTIES_PARAGRAPHS_ONLY: specifies that the properties should only be applied to paragraphs, and not the content.
wxRICHTEXT_SETPROPERTIES_CHARACTERS_ONLY: specifies that the properties should only be applied to characters, and not the paragraph.
wxRICHTEXT_SETPROPERTIES_RESET: resets (clears) the existing properties before applying the new properties.
wxRICHTEXT_SETPROPERTIES_REMOVE: removes the specified properties.

briefdescription.para: Deletes the content within the given range.
Translates from column and line number to position.
Converts a text position to zero-based column and line numbers.
Scrolls the buffer so that the given position is in view.
Copies the selected content (if any) to the clipboard.
Copies the selected content (if any) to the clipboard and deletes the selection.

detaileddescription.para: This is undoable.

briefdescription.para: Pastes content from the clipboard to the buffer.
Deletes the content in the selection, if any.

detaileddescription.para: This is undoable.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if selected content can be copied to the clipboard.
Returns true if selected content can be copied to the clipboard and deleted.
Returns true if the clipboard content can be pasted to the buffer.
Returns true if selected content can be deleted.
Undoes the command at the top of the command history, if there is one.
Redoes the current command.
Returns true if there is a command in the command history that can be undone.
Returns true if there is a command in the command history that can be redone.
Sets the insertion point and causes the current editing style to be taken from the new position (unlike wxRichTextCtrl::SetCaretPosition).
Sets the insertion point to the end of the text control.
Returns the current insertion point.
Returns the last position in the buffer.
Selects all the text in the buffer.
Makes the control editable, or not.
Returns true if there is a selection and the object containing the selection was the same as the current focus object.
Returns true if there was a selection, whether or not the current focus object is the same as the selection's container object.
Loads an image from a file and writes it at the current insertion point.
Writes an image block at the current insertion point.
Write a text box at the current insertion point, returning the text box.

detaileddescription.para: You can then call SetFocusObject() to set the focus to the new object.

briefdescription.para: Writes a field at the current insertion point.

parameterdescription.para: The field type, matching an existing field type definition.

memberdef.argsstring: (int rows, int cols, const wxRichTextAttr &tableAttr=wxRichTextAttr(), const wxRichTextAttr &cellAttr=wxRichTextAttr())
memberdef.name: WriteTable

briefdescription.para: Write a table at the current insertion point, returning the table.

detaileddescription.para: You can then call SetFocusObject() to set the focus to the new object.

briefdescription.para: Inserts a new paragraph at the current insertion point.
Inserts a line break at the current insertion point.

detaileddescription.para: A line break forces wrapping within a paragraph, and can be introduced by using this function, by appending the wxChar value wxRichTextLineBreakChar to text content, or by typing Shift-Return.

briefdescription.para: Sets the basic (overall) style.

detaileddescription.para: This is the style of the whole buffer before further styles are applied, unlike the default style, which only affects the style currently being applied (for example, setting the default style to bold will cause subsequently inserted text to be bold).

briefdescription.para: Gets the basic (overall) style.

detaileddescription.para: This is the style of the whole buffer before further styles are applied, unlike the default style, which only affects the style currently being applied (for example, setting the default style to bold will cause subsequently inserted text to be bold).

briefdescription.para: Begins applying a style.
Ends the current style.
Ends application of all styles in the current style stack.
Begins using bold.
Ends using bold.
Begins using italic.
Ends using italic.
Begins using underlining.
End applying underlining.
Begins using the given point size.
Ends using a point size.
Begins using this font.
Ends using a font.
Begins using this colour.
Ends applying a text colour.
Begins using alignment.

detaileddescription.para: For alignment values, see wxTextAttr.

briefdescription.para: Ends alignment.
Begins applying a left indent and subindent in tenths of a millimetre.

detaileddescription.para: The subindent is an offset from the left edge of the paragraph, and is used for all but the first line in a paragraph. A positive value will cause the first line to appear to the left of the subsequent lines, and a negative value will cause the first line to be indented to the right of the subsequent lines.
wxRichTextBuffer uses indentation to render a bulleted item. The content of the paragraph, including the first line, starts at the leftIndent plus the leftSubIndent.

parameterdescription.para: The distance between the margin and the bullet.
The distance between the left edge of the bullet and the left edge of the actual paragraph.

briefdescription.para: Ends left indent.
Begins a right indent, specified in tenths of a millimetre.
Ends right indent.
Begins paragraph spacing; pass the before-paragraph and after-paragraph spacing in tenths of a millimetre.
Ends paragraph spacing.
Begins appling line spacing.

detaileddescription.para: spacing is a multiple, where 10 means single-spacing, 15 means 1.5 spacing, and 20 means double spacing.
The wxTextAttrLineSpacing constants are defined for convenience.

briefdescription.para: Ends line spacing.

memberdef.argsstring: (int bulletNumber, int leftIndent, int leftSubIndent, int bulletStyle=wxTEXT_ATTR_BULLET_STYLE_ARABIC|wxTEXT_ATTR_BULLET_STYLE_PERIOD)
memberdef.name: BeginNumberedBullet

briefdescription.para: Begins a numbered bullet.

detaileddescription.para: This call will be needed for each item in the list, and the application should take care of incrementing the numbering.
bulletNumber is a number, usually starting with 1. leftIndent and leftSubIndent are values in tenths of a millimetre. bulletStyle is a bitlist of the wxTextAttrBulletStyle values.

wxRichTextBuffer uses indentation to render a bulleted item. The left indent is the distance between the margin and the bullet. The content of the paragraph, including the first line, starts at leftMargin + leftSubIndent. So the distance between the left edge of the bullet and the left of the actual paragraph is leftSubIndent.

briefdescription.para: Ends application of a numbered bullet.

memberdef.argsstring: (const wxString &symbol, int leftIndent, int leftSubIndent, int bulletStyle=wxTEXT_ATTR_BULLET_STYLE_SYMBOL)
memberdef.name: BeginSymbolBullet

briefdescription.para: Begins applying a symbol bullet, using a character from the current font.

detaileddescription.para: See BeginNumberedBullet() for an explanation of how indentation is used to render the bulleted paragraph.

briefdescription.para: Ends applying a symbol bullet.

memberdef.argsstring: (const wxString &bulletName, int leftIndent, int leftSubIndent, int bulletStyle=wxTEXT_ATTR_BULLET_STYLE_STANDARD)
memberdef.name: BeginStandardBullet

briefdescription.para: Begins applying a symbol bullet.
Begins applying a standard bullet.
Begins using the named character style.
Ends application of a named character style.
Begins applying the named paragraph style.
Ends application of a named paragraph style.
Begins using a specified list style.

detaileddescription.para: Optionally, you can also pass a level and a number.

briefdescription.para: Ends using a specified list style.
Begins applying wxTEXT_ATTR_URL to the content.

detaileddescription.para: Pass a URL and optionally, a character style to apply, since it is common to mark a URL with a familiar style such as blue text with underlining.

briefdescription.para: Ends applying a URL.
Sets the default style to the style under the cursor.
Cancels any selection.
Selects the word at the given character position.
Returns the selection range in character positions.

detaileddescription.para: -1, -1 means no selection.
The range is in API convention, i.e. a single character selection is denoted by (n, n+1)

briefdescription.para: Sets the selection to the given range.

detaileddescription.para: The end point of range is specified as the last character position of the span of text, plus one.
So, for example, to set the selection for a character at position 5, use the range (5,6).

briefdescription.para: Returns the selection range in character positions.

detaileddescription.para: -2, -2 means no selection -1, -1 means select everything. The range is in internal format, i.e. a single character selection is denoted by (n, n)

briefdescription.para: Sets the selection range in character positions.

detaileddescription.para: -2, -2 means no selection -1, -1 means select everything. The range is in internal format, i.e. a single character selection is denoted by (n, n)

briefdescription.para: Adds a new paragraph of text to the end of the buffer.
Adds an image to the control's buffer.
Lays out the buffer, which must be done before certain operations, such as setting the caret position.

detaileddescription.para: This function should not normally be required by the application.

briefdescription.para: Move the caret to the given character position.

detaileddescription.para: Please note that this does not update the current editing style from the new position; to do that, call wxRichTextCtrl::SetInsertionPoint instead.

briefdescription.para: Moves right.
Moves left.
Moves to the start of the paragraph.
Moves the caret down.
Moves to the end of the line.
Moves to the start of the line.
Moves to the end of the paragraph.
Moves to the start of the paragraph.
Moves to the start of the buffer.
Moves to the end of the buffer.
Moves one or more pages up.
Moves one or more pages down.
Moves a number of words to the left.
Move a nuber of words to the right.
Starts batching undo history for commands.
Ends batching undo command history.
Returns true if undo commands are being batched.
Starts suppressing undo history for commands.
Ends suppressing undo command history.
Returns true if undo history suppression is on.
Test if this whole range has character attributes of the specified kind.

detaileddescription.para: If any of the attributes are different within the range, the test fails.
You can use this to implement, for example, bold button updating. style must have flags indicating which attributes are of interest.

briefdescription.para: Test if this whole range has paragraph attributes of the specified kind.

detaileddescription.para: If any of the attributes are different within the range, the test fails. You can use this to implement, for example, centering button updating. style must have flags indicating which attributes are of interest.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if all of the selection, or the content at the caret position, is bold.
Returns true if all of the selection, or the content at the caret position, is italic.
Returns true if all of the selection, or the content at the caret position, is underlined.
Returns true if all of the selection, or the content at the current caret position, has the supplied wxTextAttrEffects flag(s).
Returns true if all of the selection is aligned according to the specified flag.
Apples bold to the selection or the default style (undoable).
Applies italic to the selection or the default style (undoable).
Applies underline to the selection or the default style (undoable).
Applies one or more wxTextAttrEffects flags to the selection (undoable).

detaileddescription.para: If there is no selection, it is applied to the default style.

briefdescription.para: Applies the given alignment to the selection or the default style (undoable).

detaileddescription.para: For alignment values, see wxTextAttr.

briefdescription.para: Applies the style sheet to the buffer, matching paragraph styles in the sheet against named styles in the buffer.

detaileddescription.para: This might be useful if the styles have changed. If sheet is NULL, the sheet set with SetStyleSheet() is used. Currently this applies paragraph styles only.

briefdescription.para: Sets the style sheet associated with the control.

detaileddescription.para: A style sheet allows named character and paragraph styles to be applied.

briefdescription.para: Returns the style sheet associated with the control, if any.

detaileddescription.para: A style sheet allows named character and paragraph styles to be applied.

briefdescription.para: Push the style sheet to top of stack.
Pops the style sheet from top of stack.
Applies the style sheet to the buffer, for example if the styles have changed.
Shows the given context menu, optionally adding appropriate property-editing commands for the current position in the object hierarchy.
Prepares the context menu, optionally adding appropriate property-editing commands.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the number of property commands added.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if we can edit the object's properties via a GUI.
Edits the object's properties via a GUI.
Gets the object's properties menu label.
Prepares the content just before insertion (or after buffer reset).

detaileddescription.para: Called by the same function in wxRichTextBuffer. Currently is only called if undo mode is on.

briefdescription.para: Can we delete this range? Sends an event to the control.
Can we insert content at this position? Sends an event to the control.
Enable or disable the vertical scrollbar.
Returns true if the vertical scrollbar is enabled.
Sets the scale factor for displaying fonts, for example for more comfortable editing.
Returns the scale factor for displaying fonts, for example for more comfortable editing.
Sets the scale factor for displaying certain dimensions such as indentation and inter-paragraph spacing.

detaileddescription.para: This can be useful when editing in a small control where you still want legible text, but a minimum of wasted white space.

briefdescription.para: Returns the scale factor for displaying certain dimensions such as indentation and inter-paragraph spacing.
Sets an overall scale factor for displaying and editing the content.
Returns an overall scale factor for displaying and editing the content.
Returns an unscaled point.
Returns a scaled point.
Returns an unscaled size.
Returns a scaled size.
Returns an unscaled rectangle.
Returns a scaled rectangle.
Returns true if this control can use virtual attributes and virtual text.

detaileddescription.para: The default is false.

briefdescription.para: Pass true to let the control use virtual attributes.

detaileddescription.para: The default is false.

briefdescription.para: Sends the event to the control.
Loads the first dropped file.
Standard handler for the wxID_CUT command.
Standard handler for the wxID_COPY command.
Standard handler for the wxID_PASTE command.
Standard handler for the wxID_UNDO command.
Standard handler for the wxID_REDO command.
Standard handler for the wxID_SELECTALL command.
Standard handler for property commands.
Standard handler for the wxID_CLEAR command.
Standard update handler for the wxID_CUT command.
Standard update handler for the wxID_COPY command.
Standard update handler for the wxID_PASTE command.
Standard update handler for the wxID_UNDO command.
Standard update handler for the wxID_REDO command.
Standard update handler for the wxID_SELECTALL command.
Standard update handler for property commands.
Standard update handler for the wxID_CLEAR command.
Shows a standard context menu with undo, redo, cut, copy, paste, clear, and select all commands.
Sets the font, and also the basic and default attributes (see wxRichTextCtrl::SetDefaultStyle).
A helper function setting up scrollbars, for example after a resize.
Helper function implementing keyboard navigation.
Paints the background.
Other user defined painting after everything else (i.e. all text) is painted.
Return true from here to allow the colours of this window to be changed by InheritAttributes().

detaileddescription.para: Returning false forbids inheriting them from the parent window.
The base class version returns false, but this method is overridden in wxControl where it returns true.

briefdescription.para: Internal function to position the visible caret according to the current caret position.
Helper function for extending the selection, returning true if the selection was changed.

detaileddescription.para: Selections are in caret positions.

briefdescription.para: Scrolls position into view.

detaileddescription.para: This function takes a caret position.

briefdescription.para: Refreshes the area affected by a selection change.
Sets the caret position.

detaileddescription.para: The caret position is the character position just before the caret. A value of -1 means the caret is at the start of the buffer. Please note that this does not update the current editing style from the new position or cause the actual caret to be refreshed; to do that, call wxRichTextCtrl::SetInsertionPoint instead.

briefdescription.para: Returns the current caret position.

The adjusted caret position is the character position adjusted to take into account whether we're at the start of a paragraph, in which case style information should be taken from the next position, not current one.

Move the caret one visual step forward: this may mean setting a flag and keeping the same position if we're going from the end of one line to the start of the next, which may be the exact same caret position.

Move the caret one visual step forward: this may mean setting a flag and keeping the same position if we're going from the end of one line to the start of the next, which may be the exact same caret position.
Returns the caret height and position for the given character position.

detaileddescription.para: If container is null, the current focus object will be used.
wxPerl Note: In wxPerl this method is implemented as GetCaretPositionForIndex(position) returning a 2-element list (ok, rect).

briefdescription.para: Internal helper function returning the line for the visible caret position.

detaileddescription.para: If the caret is shown at the very end of the line, it means the next character is actually on the following line. So this function gets the line we're expecting to find if this is the case.

briefdescription.para: Gets the command processor associated with the control's buffer.
Deletes content if there is a selection, e.g.

detaileddescription.para: when pressing a key. Returns the new caret position in newPos, or leaves it if there was no action. This is undoable.
wxPerl Note: In wxPerl this method takes no arguments and returns a 2-element list (ok, newPos).

briefdescription.para: Transforms logical (unscrolled) position to physical window position.
Transforms physical window position to logical (unscrolled) position.
Helper function for finding the caret position for the next word.

detaileddescription.para: Direction is 1 (forward) or -1 (backwards).

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the given position is visible on the screen.
Returns the first visible position in the current view.
Returns the caret position since the default formatting was changed.

detaileddescription.para: As soon as this position changes, we no longer reflect the default style in the UI. A value of -2 means that we should only reflect the style of the content under the caret.

briefdescription.para: Set the caret position for the default style that the user is selecting.
Returns true if the user has recently set the default style without moving the caret, and therefore the UI needs to reflect the default style and not the style at the caret.

detaileddescription.para: Below is an example of code that uses this function to determine whether the UI should show that the current style is bold.

briefdescription.para: Sets attr as the default style and tells the control that the UI should reflect this attribute until the user moves the caret.
Returns the first visible point in the window.
Returns the content of the entire control as a string.
Replaces existing content with the given text.
Processes the back key.
Given a character position at which there is a list style, find the range encompassing the same list style by looking backwards and forwards.

memberdef.argsstring: (wxRichTextParagraphLayoutBox *container, long position, int hitTestFlags, bool extendSelection=false)
memberdef.name: SetCaretPositionAfterClick

briefdescription.para: Sets up the caret for the given position and container, after a mouse click.
Find the caret position for the combination of hit-test flags and character position.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the caret position and also an indication of where to place the caret (caretLineStart) since this is ambiguous (same position used for end of line and start of next).

briefdescription.para: Processes mouse movement in order to change the cursor.
Font names take a long time to retrieve, so cache them (on demand).
Clears the cache of available font names.
Currently this simply returns wxSize(10, 10).
wxRichTextCtrl provides a generic, ground-up implementation of a text control capable of showing multiple styles and images.

detaileddescription.para: wxRichTextCtrl sends notification events: see wxRichTextEvent.
It also sends the standard wxTextCtrl events wxEVT_TEXT_ENTER and wxEVT_TEXT, and wxTextUrlEvent when URL content is clicked.
For more information, see the wxRichTextCtrl Overview.
This class supports the following styles:

wxRE_CENTRE_CARET: The control will try to keep the caret line centred vertically while editing. wxRE_CENTER_CARET is a synonym for this style.
wxRE_MULTILINE: The control will be multiline (mandatory).
wxRE_READONLY: The control will not be editable.

wxGTK Appearance
wxOSX Appearance
